meanings.sent1: In the forest, the biocenose of birds, insects, and plants work together to survive.
meanings.sent2: The marine biocenose in the coral reef is diverse and complex.
meanings.sent3: The biocenose picnic of ants, bees, and butterflies was a buzzing success.
meanings.sent4: The biocenose of students in the classroom was a harmonious symphony of learning.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the biocenose of the rainforest felt like stepping into a living, breathing world.

meanings.definition: The biotic community of a particular ecosystem.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the biocenose of the desert to understand its delicate balance.
meanings.sent2: The biocenose of the pond includes frogs, algae, and water lilies.
meanings.sent3: The biocenose party of animals in the zoo was a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The biocenose of the garden flourished with bees, flowers, and ladybugs.
meanings.sent5: The biocenose of the meadow hummed with life on a sunny day.
